nodes.text: The Relgim Run, also known as the Relgim hyperspace lane, was a hyperlane located in the Outer Rim Territories. The Run was frequently used by the luxury space liner Kuari Princess, on its voyages between Mantooine and Endoraan.

The route, which originated near the planet Fedje in the Atrivis sector, a planet that was located along the neighboring Braxant Run, another hyperspace lane that was situated in the Outer Rim Territories, stretched to the planets Fest and Generis, which were also located within the Atrivis sector, and then spanned out to the planet Vykos and the Maelstrom Nebula in the Relgim sector. It later ran through the Albarrio sector, which neighbored the Relgim sector, and stretched past the sector's worlds of Aris—another planet situated along the Braxant Run—and Marmoth.

The Relgim Run first appeared in Riders of the Maelstrom, a supplement for Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game written by Ray Winninger and published by West End Games in 1989, albeit first identified as the Relgim hyperspace lane. It later appeared in the short story "A Certain Point of View," which was written by Charlene Newcomb and published in Star Wars Adventure Journal 8 by West End Games in 1995, where the name Relgim Run was first used.
